intro: Arabis petraea var. runcinata, commonly known as the rock白菜 or mountain cabbage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
